sen.j: 源平の戦いの緒戦に疲れた源氏の武将熊谷直実は、出家して法名熊谷直実と名乗った。
sen.e: Drained from the first battle of the Genpei War (the war between the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan), Naozane KUMAGAI, busho (military commander) of the Minamoto clan, becomes a priest and calls himself Priest Naozane KUMAGAI.

sen.e: In August of autumn, Rensho visits Sumanoura Bay in Settsu Province for the purpose of offering prayers to Buddha for the happiness of TAIRA no Atsumori he killed in the Battle of Ichinotani.

sen.e: When Rensho is chanting sutra in the night, the ghost of Atsumori appears to tell about the ups and downs of the Taira clan, perform chu-no-mai dance with nostalgia for the final feast of the Taira clan, and reproduce the scene of his own death in the Battle of Ichinotani in face of Rensho.

sen.j: そしてやっと敵である直実に巡り会えたと仇を討とうとするが、すでに出家して蓮生となって弔いにつとめる直実はもはや敵ではないと悟り、極楽浄土では共に同じ蓮に生まれる身になろうと言い残して敦盛の霊は姿を消す。
sen.e: Although Atsumori tries to revenge Naozane, saying that he has finally found his enemy, he learns that Naozane who has become Priest Rensho is no longer his enemy and the ghost of Atsumori disappears, leaving words of suggestion that he and Rensho be born to be lotus in Gokuraku Jodo (the Amida Pure Land).

Although Atsumori, on having finally found his enemy tries to take revenge on Naozane, he learns that Naozane has become a priest and as Rensho was dedicated to reading sutra and was no longer his enemy; the ghost of Atsumori disappears, leaving words that he and Rensho both be born as lotus ('ren' in Rensho's name means lotus) in Gokuraku Jodo (the Amida Pure Land).
